line.token: * Log-in form for the "member" authentication method
* This field is used in the "You are logged in as %s" message
* @param Controller $controller The parent controller, necessary to
* create the appropriate form action tag.
* @param string $name The method on the controller that will return this
* @param FieldSet|FormField $fields All of the fields in the form - a
* @param FieldSet|FormAction $actions All of the action buttons in the
* @param bool $checkCurrentUser If set to TRUE, it will be checked if a
* the user is currently logged in, and if
* so, only a logout button will be rendered
* @param string $authenticatorClassName Name of the authenticator class that this form uses.
// This is now set on the class directly to make it easier to create subclasses
// Focus on the email input when the page is loaded
// Only include this if other form JS validation is enabled
* This method is called when the user clicks on "Log in"
"A member with this email already exists."
// Show the right tab on failed login
* This method is called when the user clicks on "logout" on the form
* created when the parameter $checkCurrentUser of the
* {@link __construct constructor} was set to TRUE and the user was
* @return Member Returns the member object on successful authentication
* Ensures member unique id stays unique and other basic stuff...
'%1$s is already taken by another member. Please log in or use another %2$s'
// check password fields are the same before saving
'We could not save your details, please check your errors below.'
